comments.body:
I am still confused.  Should this PR be closed.   For example, this change is a reversal of:
```
Author: Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch>
Date:   Fri Sep 21 09:59:00 2018 +0200

    Revert "Final changes to py2help new (#2516)"
    
    This reverts commit dc825fc42a674c2b03c11e1c7e96ca5e261831aa.
```
[ironically that commit is an intentional reversal but this might be a large part of the confusion] ...

If this change are intended, we need to extend the commit log to explain in detail what is the history of this changes. (why a reversal of a reversal, what's the difference, etc.)

Hi Philippe, This PR (3038) is correct. The one you are referring to (25560) was the first attempt to put in the work done by the summer student Ellie. But it broke the build under some circumstances on some machines and that was not seen by Jenkins. So it was reverted because it was a real nuisance at that time (just after summer). Now I am trying to redo it and see what is going wrong. I would need Guilherme help because he was seeing this build breakage and I was not able to reproduce it. I had also to redo this PR several time because of some conflicts appearing since summer. So to summarise:   PR 3038 (this one) is the replacement of PR 2516 which was reverted because it was creating problems under some circumstances not understood at that time.
